dt: {bc}to reverse in position, order, or relationship
{bc}to turn inside out or upside down

dt.t: to divide using fractions, {wi}invert{/wi} the divisor and multiply

dt: {bc}to reincorporate (a company) as a new entity in a foreign country {bc}to put (a company) through the process of inversion {dx_def}see {dxt|inversion||6}{/dx_def}

dt.t: Obama and Democratic leaders in Congress have questioned the patriotism of corporate executives who elect to {wi}invert{/wi} their companies.

pt: {sc}reverse{/sc} {sc}transpose{/sc} {sc}invert{/sc} mean to change to the opposite position. {sc}reverse{/sc} is the most general term and may imply change in order, side, direction, meaning.

pt.t: {it}reversed{/it} his position on the trade agreement

pt: {sc}transpose{/sc} implies a change in order or relative position of units often through exchange of position.

pt.t: {it}transposed{/it} the letters to form an anagram

pt: {sc}invert{/sc} applies chiefly to turning upside down or inside out.

shortdef: to reverse in position, order, or relationship
to turn inside out or upside down
